title.narrative: 3.3 - ADOLESCENTS LITERACY AND LIFE-SKILLS EDUCATION

description.narrative: 3.3-The Ministry of Education has increased capacity to provide adolescents (ages 10-19) with life skills education and ensure school enrolment at an age appropriate level through non-formal and formal classes, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Adolescent Empowerment, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, all children, especially the most disadvantaged benefit from improved access, participation and learning outcomes in pre- primary and basic education within inclusive, safe and protective environments.

title.narrative: 3.3-The Ministry of Education has increased capacity to provide adolescents (ages 10-19) with life skills education and ensureschool enrolment at an age appropriate level through non-formal and formal classes

description.narrative: 1,325 adolescent girls from disadvantaged social groups and communities of Province 2 have;been (re)enrolled and retained in formal education at an age-appropriate level;through non-formal;accelerated;learning programs, that were co-financed by seven local governments;for a total of;$;66,000. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/12/2021
